```{r options, eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
options(repr.plot.width=4, repr.plot.height=4)
```

```{r params, include=FALSE}
if(!exists("params")) {
    params<-list(x=22.2,mu=23,sigma=4)
}
x<-params$x
mu<-params$mu 
sigma<-params$sigma 
```

```{r computed, include=FALSE}
numer<-(x-mu); 
z<-round((x-mu)/sigma,2)
```

Suppose that $\mu=`r mu`$, $\sigma=`r sigma`$ and $x = `r x`$. Then we can find the value of z as follows:

$$
z =\frac{x-\mu}{\sigma} =\frac{`r x`-`r mu`}{`r sigma`} =\frac{`r numer`}{`r sigma`} =`r z`
$$

```{r graphics, include=FALSE}
Z <- seq(-4, 4, length=200)
Y <- dnorm(Z, mean=0, sd=1)
plot(Z,Y, type = "l", lwd = 2, xlab="z", ylab = "", xlim = c(-3.5,3.5))
```
